results.definition: the act of firing a projectile
examples: his shooting was slow but accurate

results.definition: a solid missile discharged from a firearm
examples: the shot buzzed past his ear

results.definition: (sports) the act of swinging or striking at a ball with a club or racket or bat or cue or hand
examples: it took two strokes to get out of the bunker
a good shot requires good balance and tempo
he left me an almost impossible shot

results.definition: a chance to do something
examples: he wanted a shot at the champion

results.definition: a person who shoots (usually with respect to their ability to shoot)
examples: he is a crack shot
a poor shooter

results.definition: a consecutive series of pictures that constitutes a unit of action in a film
the act of putting a liquid into the body by means of a syringe
examples: the nurse gave him a flu shot

results.definition: a small drink of liquor
examples: he poured a shot of whiskey

results.definition: an aggressive remark directed at a person like a missile and intended to have a telling effect
examples: his parting shot was `drop dead'
she threw shafts of sarcasm
she takes a dig at me every chance she gets

results.definition: an estimate based on little or no information
an informal photograph; usually made with a small hand-held camera
examples: my snapshots haven't been developed yet
he tried to get unposed shots of his friends

results.definition: sports equipment consisting of a heavy metal ball used in the shot put
examples: he trained at putting the shot

results.definition: an explosive charge used in blasting
a blow hard enough to cause injury
examples: he is still recovering from a shot to his leg
I caught him with a solid shot to the chin

results.definition: an attempt to score in a game
informal words for any attempt or effort
examples: he gave it his best shot
he took a stab at forecasting

results.definition: the launching of a missile or spacecraft to a specified destination
hit with a missile from a weapon
kill by firing a missile
fire a shot
examples: the gunman blasted away

results.definition: make a film or photograph of something
examples: take a scene
shoot a movie

results.definition: send forth suddenly, intensely, swiftly
examples: shoot a glance

results.definition: run or move very quickly or hastily
examples: She dashed into the yard

results.definition: move quickly and violently
examples: The car tore down the street
He came charging into my office

results.definition: throw or propel in a specific direction or towards a specific objective
examples: shoot craps
shoot a golf ball

results.definition: record on photographic film
examples: I photographed the scene of the accident
She snapped a picture of the President

results.definition: emit (as light, flame, or fumes) suddenly and forcefully
examples: The dragon shot fumes and flames out of its mouth

results.definition: cause a sharp and sudden pain in
examples: The pain shot up her leg

results.definition: force or drive (a fluid or gas) into by piercing
examples: inject hydrogen into the balloon

results.definition: variegate by interweaving weft threads of different colors
examples: shoot cloth

results.definition: throw dice, as in a crap game
spend frivolously and unwisely
examples: Fritter away one's inheritance

results.definition: score
examples: shoot a basket
shoot a goal

results.definition: utter fast and forcefully
examples: She shot back an answer

results.definition: measure the altitude of by using a sextant
examples: shoot a star

results.definition: produce buds, branches, or germinate
examples: the potatoes sprouted

results.definition: give an injection to
examples: We injected the glucose into the patient's vein

results.definition: varying in color when seen in different lights or from different angles
examples: changeable taffeta
chatoyant (or shot) silk
a dragonfly hovered, vibrating and iridescent
